children.text:
Then, convert count to a string. Then process the string s.

Now, code outline:

program main

    implicit none

    integer :: N, count, i, j, k, dx, dy, x, y, flag
    integer, dimension(:), allocatable :: A
    character(len=100) :: s
    integer, dimension(2, 101) :: co

    ! First part: read N and A, compute count

    read *, N
    allocate(A(N))
    read *, A(1:N)

    count =0
    i =1
    do while (i <= N) if (i == N) then
            count = count +1 i = i +1
        else if (A(i) == A(i+1)) then
            i = i +1
        else if (A(i) < A(i+1)) then
            do while (i < N .and. A(i) <= A(i+1)) i = i +1
            end do
            count = count +1 i = i +1
        else
            do while (i < N .and. A(i) >= A(i+1)) i = i +1
            end do
            count = count +1 i = i +1
        end if
    end do

    ! Convert count to string s
    write(s, '(I0)') count
    s = adjustl(s)  ! Remove leading spaces

    ! Second part: process s
    x =0
    y =0
    k =1
    co(1,1) =x
    co(2,1) =y

    do i =1, len_trim(s)
        character :: c = s(i:i)
        select case (c)
            case ('L')
                x =x -1
            case ('R')
                x =x +1
            case ('U')
                y =y +1
            case ('D') y =y -1
            case default
                !
children.label: high_level_plan

children.text:
Invalid character, but according to problem, input is valid
        end select
        k =k +1
        co(1,k) =x
        co(2,k) =y
    end do

    flag =1  ! Assume OK initially

    do i =1, k-3
        do j =i+3, k
            dx = abs(co(1,i) - co(1,j))
            dy = abs(co(2,i) - co(2,j)) if ( (dx <=1 .and. dy ==0) .or. (dy <=1 .and. dx ==0) ) then
                flag =0
                exit
            end if
        end do
        if (flag ==0) exit
    end do

    if (flag ==1) then
        print *, 'OK'
    else
        print *, 'BUG'
    end if

end program main
